intro: Mercurialis longifolia, commonly known as the slender mercury or sweet mercury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The plant is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and scrublands.
